name: Brazilian Rainbow Boa
description: It has an unmistakable appearance—dark, thin rings pattern a brown-rust base, with scales displaying a striking iridescent sheen.
image_alt: Brazilian rainbow boa, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
reproduction: Females give birth to up to 30 young after a 5–6-month gestation.
attractions: The Brazilian rainbow boa forms up to 9 subspecies varying in color, all with a characteristic iridescent sheen. Active at dusk, it prefers hunting on the ground over trees.
breeding: We have kept the nominate subspecies at the zoo since 1992, starting with two individuals of unknown origin. One lived until 2004, the other until 2006. The first successful breeding occurred in 2000.
